Like last year, I would like to continue this new found tradition of mine and just list some of the things that I am thankful for. I know I could never list all the things that I am thankful for but I guess the things I list are the things most important to me right now.
I am thankful for:
~ My faith and the best gift of all that God has given us, Jesus
~ My parents, who support me and give me more than I ever hoped to deserve and have given me the best life I could imagine
~ My brother, who also spoils me like crazy and is a great role model and the fact that he will now only be 30 minutes away after this semester
~ The rest of my family, who always cares about my life no matter how long it's been since they last saw me and again, like to spoil me
~ My amazing friends, who always make me feel happy and have helped me get through college and given me so many fond memories, as well as always laughing at me as I laugh by myself :D
~ Living in a house/dorm

~ Going to UNC-Chapel Hill, a great university where there is a good balance of academics and a great student life
~ Big warm sweaters
~ Cosmic Cantina, The Yogurt Pump, and Gumby's (especially Pokey Sticks)
~ Free movies at the Student Union
~ My hallmates, who are always so much fun (like ultimate frisbee, poker, eating food, watching movies)
~ Buses that take you to the Harris Teeter in Chapel Hill
~ Outta Here
~ Computers
~ Blankets
~ The gym
~ AP and IB credit at UNC
~ Music and the composers who create it and the performers who play it
~ Ruckus

~ Love

Well I have now been at school for over a month...and I must say it has been great. I've enjoyed almost all of it except for math homework and the thought of upcoming midterms. But there's plenty of other things to make up for that. Like having almost all of Friday free to traverse the campus with Jennifer and have movie marathons. I think our record is 5 1/2 movies. And of course our workouts at the gym, especially funk and butts, gutts, and thigh class. Then there's our Friday night cooking experiments and DE ;) And I must not forget the many interesting, yet fun nights with my hallmates...playing poker and all sorts of other games two or three times a week and of course playing ultimate frisbee until 2:30 am. Go minorities! I have also really enjoyed ballroom dancing...especially the tango. (Hannah makes for a good guy ;) and I still haven't ever had to dance the lead part which is quite an accomplishment.) There are still so many other fun experiences (like running all the way from Franklin street to Jennifer's dorm for a TV show and squished car rides to and from school) but I would be going on forever. Well it's nice to be home now for the weekend and be spoiled by my parents :) Whenever I come back to Charlotte it feels like I have not been away for more than a few days, which makes me realize just how important it is to come home and how much I love it. Well that's all for now...just hoping I do well on my midterms and all those who have to take midterms soon as well.

So I have now been in Carolina for a week, and I must say it was better than I expected. The people here are great and all the activities on campus have been fun and I'm really just enjoying everything here. The classes seem more like they will be interesting and not as much work as back in IB. Also, I placed out of English 101 which was a great relief to me and I got the piano lessons that I auditioned for. So all in all things have worked out for the best for me and I look forward to the next few years here. I could go on with more little details but I don't think anybody would care to read them and I don't feel like writing that much so I shall end it here.

So today I went to help at the church my mom works at by stuffing bulletins with a sheet and stapling more sheets. Anyways, this older couple helped me stuff the bulletins and, well the old guy was interesting. When his wife left to get a box he complained about her to me and then asked me where I was going for school and what I wanted to study. I obviously said Carolina and I want to study business. When I said that he said, "Wow so you got accepted and everything"...like I would go to a college where I wasn't accepted, but I'm pretty sure he was joking. Anywho, he then said, "Do you know another name for Business administration?" and I said, "um......no" and he said "Jewish engineering" which I thought was quite clever and I even laughed. Then his wife came back and asked me where I was going and before I could say anything the guy said, "She's going to Carolina to study medicine. She's going to become a doctor and practice in Cuba." So what was I supposed to do??? I just didn't say anything and laughed to myself some more. Then after working there I went to Bruegger's and Caribou for lunch and surprise surprise, I saw Hannah! Or rather she honked at me as I walked on and then yelled at me and then I finally saw her. So we had lunch together, bought batteries and I saw a friend of hers at Starbucks although I doubt he saw me...oh and Hannah's car handle broke which was kinda funny and bad at the same time. Anywho, it was just a nice surprise to have lunch with Hannah again out of the blue and listen to an old man's interesting comments.

Well since I last wrote I went to Philly and came back and then went to orientation. Philadelphia was everything a history dork like me could hope for. I spent a whole day there just looking at all the historic sites plus I had my Philly cheesesteak. Valley Forge was pretty cool too, but there's not much to do there except drive around the park and look at monuments. Orientation on the other hand was just alright. It wasn't that much fun and most of the time I was just anxious to sign up for classes since I thought there would be no good classes left. But luckily I got all the classes I wanted, plus some...I would write down my schedule but it might change so I'm not going to waste my time. However I do like my schedule now as I will only have one class on Wednesday and Fridays and they're at 9 so I have the rest of the day to do nothing, so I'm really hoping that won't change. Other than that I've just been hanging out with friends and chilling at home. I've hung out with Sangeeta (we went crazy with the digital camera), Hannah ("We're not really a Starbucks, we just sell their coffee and have the same menu and have their logo on everything"), Christina (Disney songs rock my socks), Sal (tennis is awesome), Daniel (Band of Brothers is great but Family Guy not so much), and I plan to hang out with Priyanka, Woody, Armanda, and more of the same people for the rest of summer as well. I've seen so many movies over this summer so it's hard to choose one for quotes but I'll try. By the way, I really really like the new Pride and Prejudice movie, and I must confess I like this Mr. Darcy more than Colin Firth's Darcy. I know this will shock many, but I had to get it out. Amanda no longer has Firthitis.

So I have taken 3 exams in 2 days, and I would like to call it quits now. Not that the exams have been extremely difficult or anything, but they make me realize how sometimes even after sitting in a class for a year,  it still won't fully prepare me for these exams, no matter how hard I try. But despite the two exams today, English and Statistics, hanging out with two of my best friends totally made it worth it. So now our list may expand tenfold Sangeeta! One cannot forget the lady at Subway who doesn't speak English, singing to songs we don't know the words to, or Sangeeta pumping gas by herself for the first time. Well since I last wrote, I not only finished that history poster, but I just turned in the last project ever for Mr. Layton yesterday (provided that I don't do the optional grading project, which I have not done all year). Also, one more week until IB and AP exams, which isn't the most fun thing to do, but at least I'll barely have to go to school for May. It's hard to believe we only have a month and a half left. It seems the only thing we talk about now is where everyone is going for college and prom. Well I have decided to go to UNC-Chapel Hill and I'll most likely live on North campus or at Carmichael on Middle campus. I may not be as crazy about the school as others are, but I think I'll be happy there and I'll be able to see a lot of my friends still, which is good. As for prom, it sure has been an interesting road getting there, but I am very happy with my date and I know it will be a great night. This was one of the best weekends I have had in a while. It may not seem great to some people, but it was the little things that made it so great for me and I wish I could have spent more weekends like this with my friends. Well, on Friday, after picking up those dreadful little things that we call our World Lit. papers I went to Starbucks to meet Hannah, Daniel, and Elena, although I didn't drink anything since everything there goes against my dietary restrictions. Well then Hannah and Elena had to leave so Daniel and I were trying to fill the time between then and soccer and just walked around the shopping center twice and went inside Party Land where we made fun of the over the hill decorations. We then proceeded to go to the park for soccer although Daniel took the shortcut without telling me, so I showed up later but that didn't really matter since nobody else showed up. So Daniel and I just took shots and passed the ball and I found out how much I sucked. He also showed me how to kick the ball right which is really sad that I'm figuring this out now after my last season of soccer. Oh well, it was a lot of fun and during the hour and a half we were there I got 4 calls from Elizabeth about what were going to do that evening which was muy divertido. So after soccer, Daniel and I were trying to pass each other, safely of course, until we went our separate ways and I headed for Elizabeth's house. At Elizabeth's house we talked until Armanda and Priyanka came and then went out for some Chinese food and to rent Love Actually. Walking into Blockbuster, the four of us saw Coach Simmons, who is the PE coach for 3 of us and I was strutting because we had just listened to rap and unfortunately I believe Coach Simmons saw me. Oh well, as we were driving off Armanda and I were dancing to rap in the car and I believe Coach Simmons saw us do that as well as he told us to have a safe weekend, which just added to fun of the night. Once we got back to Elizabeth's house we ate our food on the floor and watched Love Actually. I don't know how many times I said awwwwww, but I'm sure it was a lot. 
After the movie I went home because the on Saturday I had to go work at Christina's house for our Group IV project. So at Christina's I would like to say we did some work, but not really. Her internet connection was bad so we just talked and ate Samoas and sang Disney songs and played the piano. Priyanka and I did our best to convince Christina she should go to prom but first we need to get her date. I believe Priyanka and Elizabeth are working on that. It sounds stupid, but it was so much fun. Then I came home and did nothing until my family and I went to mass and then to Mr. Fisher's house to celebrate his birthday. That may also sound dorky but it was a lot of good fun and we also played Texas Hold Em in which case I believe I won the most money. It's something that just runs in the family. Well I just got back from St. Louis today. It was so much fun because my mom and I did a road trip to St. Louis stopping at these awesome state resort parks in Kentucky. We also got to see Mammoth Cave, which is the longest cave in the world, which they tell you over and over. It was so cool down there, I mean literally and figuratively. We just went on a short tour because I wasn't sure if I could handle a longer tour, but the short tour was enough for me. Just walking through the cave and hearing the history behind it was so interesting. I know that sounds dorky, but I love history. The best part was when our guide was telling us about one time when someone got left behind on a tour and had to stay in the dark there for 24 hours, and then right after she told us that, the lights went out. Someone didn't know that we were down there so they turned off the light by accident, so here we were in complete darkness, like nothing I've ever experienced before, and our guide has to find the old grease light that they used in the 1800s to find our way back to the switch. It really gave us a feel for how it was to explore the cave years ago. Anyways, in St. Louis we were staying with family friends who were having the baptism of their daughter. I started getting a rash on my face on Saturday and it just got worse, and spread all over my torso, so that now it is really uncomfortable, but I've been to the doctor and now have more medicine to help with the allergic reaction. But other than that, the trip was so much fun!
